intro: Mesadenus lucayanus, commonly known as the Lucayan mesadenus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branching. This species is often found in coastal areas and moist woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
